articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Deutsch and Brzezinski offer reasons for why Trump skipped WWI...
articles.description: Avoiding a bad hair day? Mike Brzeszinski and Donny Deutsch offer theories on why Donald Trump skipped the memorial service for WWI veterans.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: BREAKING: Roger Stone associate expected to be indicted for...
articles.description: Anna Schecter reports that Roger Stone associate, Jerome Corsi expects to be indicted by the Mueller probe for advanced knowledge of the 'October surprise' emails.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Jarrett: Michelle Obama hopes to inspire, send a message with new book
articles.description: In her new book, Michelle Obama criticized President Trump for his birther claims and the threat it presented to her husband and family. Valerie Jarrett, close friend and senior adviser to the Obamas, joins Andrea Mitchell.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Full Connolly: Idea that House Dems are going to go ‘subpoena crazy’ is false
articles.description: Rep. Gerry Connolly (D-Va.) joins MTP Daily to discuss reports that top Democrats in the House are preparing an onslaught subpoenas for the Trump Administration and what issues they will prioritize.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Monday's Mini-Report, 11.12.18
articles.description: Today's edition of quick hits.
articles.content: Today’s edition of quick hits: * The latest out of California : Deadly wildfires burning across Northern and Southern California have killed a total of 31 people across the state and forced the evacuation of hundreds of thousands. * Someone should let the Whi… [+1980 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Gillum lawyer: ‘These are not fraud problems, they're problems with the system’
articles.description: Andrew Gillum’s attorney, Barry Richard, joins MTP Daily to discuss the recount in the Florida gubernatorial race and the possibility of legal action.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Gillum lawyer: Elections are resolved 'in the courtroom, not the streets'
articles.description: Andrew Gillum's lawyer Barry Richard talks to Katy about the rhetoric surrounding the midterm recounts in Florida.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: One More Thing: Thousands of veterans waiting for benefits
articles.description: President Trump’s “Forever GI” bill greatly expanded benefits for veterans, but didn’t upgrade the VA’s technical capabilities, causing over 82,000 veterans to get stuck waiting for benefits they earned by serving.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Mississippi Sen. Hyde-Smith caught on video joking about 'public hanging'
articles.description: Mississippi Sen. Hyde-Smith (R-MS) is defending her comments joking that she'd accept her African-American opponent's invitation to a "public hanging."

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Unbelievable: Mississippi Senator jokes about ‘public hanging’
articles.description: Republican Cindy Hyde-Smith, who will face Democrat Mike Espy in a runoff this month, used the term “public hanging,” while praising a supporter—something she is facing criticism for given Mississippi’s brutal history of racial terror.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: California wildfires and the environment
articles.description: Director of Cal Fire, Chief Ken Pimlott, and professor of geography at UCLA, Glen MacDonald join Katy Tur to respond to the President’s claims that the California wildfires were a result of poor forest management.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Big Question: Can voters be confident in the outcome of an election as the president is claiming fraud?
articles.description: Officials in Florida have until Thursday to recount ballots in the Senate and Gubernatorial races. This morning President Trump claimed, again without evidence, that any outcome would be tainted.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Will Stacey Abrams get enough votes for runoff in GA governor race?
articles.description: Lauren Groh-Wargo, campaign manager for GA Democratic gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams, explains to Ali Velshi  why the campaign filed a lawsuit challenging a rejection of votes and why Abrams is “a candidate and a cause worth voting for.”

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: The conflict in Yemen: 'Our goal is to show what’s happening there'
articles.description: The U.S. is involved in a proxy war in Yemen that has killed at least 10,000, and left more than 22 million in dire need of help. Ali Velshi talks with New York Times contributing writer Robert Worth and photojournalist Lynsey Addario about their eye-opening …

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Markets down 600 points on tech stock tumble and fear of trade wars
articles.description: The Dow closed 600 points lower due to a tumble in Apple and Amazon shares and looming concerns of ongoing trade wars.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Trump raises eyebrows with treatment of...
articles.description: It matters that Trump's admonishments have been factually incorrect. It also matters that he seems especially indignant toward certain groups of people.
articles.content: At a White House press conference last week, PBS’s Yamiche Alcindor reminded Donald Trump that he’s described himself as a nationalist, which she suggested may have emboldened white nationalists. Before she could continue, the president interrupted to accuse … [+2053 chars]

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Acting Attorney General tied to fraud scheme under FBI investigation
articles.description: The nation's current chief law-enforcement official helped lead "an invention-promotion scam that has bilked thousands of consumers out of millions of dollars."
articles.content: New Trump acting-AG tied to fraud scheme under FBI investigation There are so many reasons Donald Trump shouldn’t have chosen Matt Whitaker to serve as acting attorney general, it’s genuinely challenging to choose just one. But by any fair measure, Whitaker’s… [+2977 chars]

articles.title: Morning Joe 11/12/18
articles.description: Joe and Mika discuss the big news of the day.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Reality discredits fraud allegations from Trump, Florida's Scott
articles.description: It's hard to say for sure who's been more irresponsible: Trump or Rick Scott. Either way, the only real fraud in Florida is from those who've alleged fraud.
articles.content: Donald Trump and Florida Gov. Rick Scott (R) aren’t the only ones who’ve peddled election-related conspiracy theories – Rudy Giuliani and Sen. Marco Rubio (R) have, alas, dipped their toes in the same misguided waters – but the president and the governor have… [+2346 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Troops remain at southern border as Trump zeroes in on caravan
articles.description: Some 5,600 U.S. troops have taken their positions along the southern U.S. border as the deployment itself could cost up to $220 million.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: California Firefighter: Trump's comments 'ill-timed' due to loss of life
articles.description: Brian Rice, President of the California Professional Firefighters, tells Hallie Jackson that he stands by his comments in response to President Trump's tweet about the California fires being ill-timed: "The statement that the president made, one-it was, it wa…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: ‘Headstrong Project’ provides assistance for veterans struggling with mental health
articles.description: Joe Quinn, the Executive Director of "Headstrong Project" - an organization founded to help veterans struggling with mental health issues, joins Craig Melvin to discuss the everyday challenges veterans face.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Republican conspiracy theory about Arizona voting proves untenable
articles.description: Republican conspiracy theories about Arizona's Senate race are so unbelievable, some in the GOP won't repeat them.
articles.content: As the dust settled on Election Day last week, Martha McSally (R) appeared to have a narrow lead over Kyrsten Sinema (D) in Arizona’s closely watched U.S. Senate race. But as the process continued to unfold, it was Sinema who took the lead, and as the Arizona… [+2843 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Kornacki’s ballot breakdown
articles.description: Steve Kornacki breaks down the Florida races still being watched nearly a week after the midterm elections, and how the states’ ballot design may have played a major role in the outcome.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: As VA struggles to administer GI Bill benefits, veterans suffer financially
articles.description: The delay by the Department of Veterans Affairs in administering the GI Bill benefits is caused by a series of information technology glitches. NBC’s Phil McCausland offers more details.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Fire survivor to husband: 'I can't get out of my car, it's on fire'
articles.description: Deadly wildfires burning across Northern and Southern California have forced the evacuation of hundreds of thousands people across the state. “We were seeing deer and other animals on fire,” said Jackie Gayle, a mother who survived the wildfire. NBC News’ Ste…

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Monday's Campaign Round-Up, 11.12.18
articles.description: Today's installment of campaign-related news items from across the country.
articles.content: Today’s installment of campaign-related news items from across the country. * In Georgia, Stacey Abrams (D) is still exploring every possible avenue to force a gubernatorial runoff election against Brian Kemp (R). * As of this morning, Democrats are ahead in … [+1932 chars]

articles.title: Steve King's comments about Mexican 'dirt' spark new controversy
articles.description: If Steve King's Republican brethren are serious about "standing up against white supremacy," there are steps they could take to prove it.
articles.content: With time running out ahead of the toughest race of his career, Republican Rep. Steve King hit the campaign trail in his Iowa district, hoping to salvage his career. A reporter from The Weekly Standard was on hand in Webster City, Iowa, on Nov. 5, when the ri… [+2741 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Felix Salmon: Finance cmte. could spray ‘t-shirt cannon of subpoenas’ on DC
articles.description: Money, Power, Politics: Rep. Maxine Waters seemed to give a preview of the agenda we could see from the Finance Committee in January. Stephanie Ruhle is joined by Felix Salmon – Axios’ Chief Financial Correspondent and author of Axios Edge Newsletter who says…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: O’Brien: Interesting Trump targets FL, AZ but not GA on voter fraud
articles.description: Stephanie Ruhle is joined by Bloomberg Opinions Executive Editor Tim O’Brien and Reason Magazine Editor-At-Large Matt Welch to discuss President Trump’s handling of the lingering midterm races and his comments about the California wildfires.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Historic wave of veterans elected in midterms
articles.description: Rye Barcott of the veterans group With Honor joins Morning Joe to discuss the record number of veterans elected to Congress in the 2018 midterms.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: A look at midterm races still up for grabs nearly a week after elections
articles.description: Stephanie Ruhle breaks down the races in Arizona and Florida that have still not been called. This comes as the president continues to spew baseless claims of “massively infected” ballots.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Will Nancy Pelosi return as House speaker?
articles.description: Will Nancy Pelosi resume her job as House Speaker in the new term? Kasie Hunt discusses.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Vladimir Putin is going to need a new favorite congressman
articles.description: Kevin McCarthy joked in 2016, "There's two people I think Putin pays: Rohrabacher and Trump." One of those two is exiting the stage, rebuked by voters.
articles.content: In a closed-door event in 2016, House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-Calif.) told his Republican colleagues, There’s two people I think Putin pays: Rohrabacher and Trump. The latter, of course, was Donald Trump, the presidential candidate the Kremlin was e… [+2848 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Broward County ballot design scrutinized amid Florida recount
articles.description: The Broward County ballot design is being scrutinized as a possible factor in missed votes for in the Florida  U.S. Senate race amid a statewide recount.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: ‘House of Cards’ star talks real-life political drama
articles.description: Michael Kelly, star of the Netflix series “House of Cards,” sits down with Stephanie Ruhle to discuss the similarities and differences between the show and current day politics.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Gillum campaign lawyer: A lawsuit has always been on the table
articles.description: Barry Richard, attorney for the Gillum Campaign, joins Hallie Jackson to discuss the Florida recount - indicating Andrew Gillum is talking to him about possibly suing and that he feels an obligation to ensure that all votes are counted.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: GOP senator with black rival tells joke about 'public hanging'
articles.description: Given her state's history, and her opponent's race, it's not unreasonable to argue that Hyde-Smith should've avoided unprompted comments about public hangings.
articles.content: The 2018 midterm elections aren’t quite over yet. Not only are there still several pending races where the votes are still being tallied, but there’s also a U.S. Senate race in Mississippi that’s headed for a runoff. At first blush, given Mississippi’s partis… [+3028 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: 'Be for something,' says incoming congresswoman
articles.description: Democratic Rep.-elect Abigail Spanberger says it's not enough for Democrats to just be against President Trump, but they have to be for something as lawmakers.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Reality gets in the way of Mike Pence's Veterans Day pitch
articles.description: Mike Pence seems eager for a discussion about Trump's support for veterans. The White House may not like where this conversation ends up.
articles.content: The debt our Nation owes those who have worn the uniform is a debt we will never be able to fully repay, Vice President Mike Pence wrote yesterday in a tweet recognizing Veterans Day. But just as those courageous men and women have fought for us, [Donald] Tru… [+3179 chars]

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Trump's response to deadly California...
articles.description: Even putting aside the falsehoods, what kind of president blames Americans for a deadly natural disaster, while the crisis is still unfolding?
articles.content: It was August when Donald Trump first started sharing his thoughts on California wildfires, which the president was eager to blame on Gov. Jerry Brown (D) and bad environmental laws. As regular readers may recall, none of Trump’s rhetoric made sense. The Wash… [+2659 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sherrod Brown lays out areas of focus for Dems
articles.description: Sen. Sherrod Brown, D-Ohio, was re-elected to third term after defeating GOP Rep. Jim Renacci, and he joins Morning Joe to discuss his re-election and the road ahead.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Rashida Tlaib calls for leading with compassion
articles.description: Rep.-elect Rashida Tlaib joins Morning Joe to share what it's like to be Muslim in America in 2018 and why she plans on leading with compassion when she gets to Washington.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rick Scott again claims fraud in the Florida race
articles.description: Florida Republican Gov. Rick Scott said in a Monday interview his Senate challenger Bill Nelson is attempting to steal the Florida election. A recount in the race began on Saturday, and Scott currently maintains a lead. Joe Scarborough weighs in.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sen. Coons: Whitaker should recuse himself from Russia investigation
articles.description: Sen. Chris Coons and Jeff Flake will be calling for a vote to protect Special Counsel Robert Mueller in the coming week.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: At international gathering, Trump finds himself isolated and alone
articles.description: Many of Trump's failures as president relate to governing, but we're occasionally reminded of how routinely he struggles in simple, ceremonial tasks.
articles.content: Donald Trump traveled abroad in July for a series of key international events, each of which proved to be deeply embarrassing for the American president and his administration. Senate Foreign Relations Committee Chairman Bob Corker (R-Tenn.) described Trump’s… [+4232 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: As wildfires rage, Trump attacks California
articles.description: President Trump also weighed in over the weekend on the California wildfires, claiming 'poor' forest management was in part to blame for the massive fires. Trump also threatened to hold federal money due to 'gross mismanagement'.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Joe: Trump embarrassed himself in France, not America
articles.description: Over the weekend, President Trump traveled to France to mark the centennial of the end of World War. While there, Trump skipped a ceremony honoring fallen American WWI soldiers. The panel discusses.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Things not 'good at all' for GOP, warns columnist
articles.description: 'This election is very bad for the GOP, and harbingers ill for 2020,' writes John Podhoretz in a new Commentary column. Podhoretz joins Morning Joe to discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: A record number of women elected to the House
articles.description: At least 35 incoming House members are women, a figure that breaks the record of 24 set in 1992, and the total of 101 female members will be the largest number in history. The panel discusses.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sen. Coons: Whitaker should recuse himself from Russia investigation
articles.description: Sens. Chris Coons and Jeff Flake will be calling for a vote to protect Special Counsel Robert Mueller in the coming week.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sen. Coons: Whitaker should recuse himself from Russia investigation
articles.description: Sens. Chris Coons and Jeff Flake will be calling for a vote to protect Special Counsel Robert Mueller in the coming week.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: NM Gov.-Elect Lujan Grisham: Caravan not a threat
articles.description: The newly elected governor, who made history as the first ever Latina Democratic Governor from New Mexico, says President Trump's rhetoric towards the migrant caravan is 'deeply troubling.'

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Democrats read 2018 tea leaves to determine 2020 candidates
articles.description: Democrats are looking at the Midwest and at women voters to give them the support they need to beat President Trump in 2020 presidential elections.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Whitaker likely to be quickly replaced as Attorney General
articles.description: While it is not clear how long Acting Attorney General Matthew Whitaker will hold his role, new reporting indicates it may not be much longer before Americans see a permanent replacement.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rep. Bustos: New generation of Democratic leaders may not include Speakership
articles.description: Democratic voters across the country are calling for new leadership at the top of their party, including replacing Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi as she runs for Speaker of the House.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rep.-Elect Cunningham: I will not vote for Pelosi for speaker
articles.description: After a stunning win in South Carolina's deep-red 1st District, Rep.-Elect Joe Cunningham says he will not support House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi's run for Speaker of the House.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Macron denounces nationalism as Trump and the world look on
articles.description: On the 100th anniversary of the WWI Armistice, a rebuke from France’s president shows America’s shifting dynamics on the world stage.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Dems fight to save Mueller probe, claim acting AG Whitaker is biased
articles.description: A critic of Special Counsel Robert Mueller, Matthew Whitaker, was installed as the acting Attorney General this week.  MSNBC’s Richard Lui talks with his panel about what action Democrats could take if Whitaker meddles in the Russia probe.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Mandatory vote recount underway in Florida, GOP cries foul
articles.description: Election workers have begun sorting through ballots in Florida to insure the accuracy of three midterm elections. MSNBC’s Richard Lui discusses what’s next with his panel.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Scott campaign sues Florida election supervisors during recount
articles.description: Multiple Florida races have come down to the wire, prompting recounts and lawsuits. MSNBC’s Ayman Mohyeldin discusses the implications of the elections with his panel.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: New Congresswoman: ‘We need to tackle’ healthcare
articles.description: Elissa Slotkin, a former CIA analyst,  was recently elected to represent Michigan in Congress during the midterm election. MSNBC’s Ayman Mohyeldin asks Slotkin about what she wants to accomplish in office and her views on the race to be the speaker of the Hou…
